### Basic Terary Contour Plot

```{r, results = 'hide'}
library(plotly)
library(rjson)

df <- fromJSON(file="https://gist.githubusercontent.com/davenquinn/988167471993bc2ece29/raw/f38d9cb3dd86e315e237fde5d65e185c39c931c2/data.json") 

colors = c('#8dd3c7','#ffffb3','#bebada',
          '#fb8072','#80b1d3','#fdb462',
          '#b3de69','#fccde5','#d9d9d9',
          '#bc80bd','#ccebc5','#ffed6f');

p <- plot_ly()

for (i in 1:length(df)) {
  l = c()
  m = c()
  n = c()
  
  for (j in 1:length(df[[i]])) {
    l[[j]] <- df[[i]][[j]]$clay
    m[[j]] <- df[[i]][[j]]$sand
    n[[j]] <- df[[i]][[j]]$silt
  }
  
  p <- add_trace(
    p,
    type = 'scatterternary',
    a = l,
    b = m,
    c = n,
    name = names(df[i]),
    mode = 'lines',
    line = list(
      color='#444'
    ),
    fill = 'toself',
    fillcolor = colors[i],
    showlegend = F
    )
}

p <- layout(
  p,
  title = "Simple Ternary Contour Plot in R",
  ternary = list(
    sum = 100,
    aaxis = list(
      title = "clay",
      ticksuffix = "%",
      min = 0.01,
      linewidth = 2,
      ticks = "outside"
    ),
    baxis = list(
      title = "sand",
      ticksuffix = "%",
      min = 0.01,
      linewidth = 2,
      ticks = "outside"
    ),
    caxis = list(
      title = "silt",
      ticksuffix = "%",
      min = 0.01,
      linewidth = 2,
      ticks = "outside"
    )
  )
)

# Create a shareable link to your chart
# Set up API credentials: https://plot.ly/r/getting-started
chart_link = api_create(p, filename="ternarycontour/basic")
chart_link
```

